content.description:
Pliny and a Parent

Castigabatcastigo, -are: to punish quidam pater filium suum quod paulo 
sumptuosiussumptuosus, -a, -um, adj.: extravagant  equos et canes emeret. Huic ego iuvene 
egresso dixi: “Heusheus: hey! (interjection to get someone’s attention) tu numquamne fecisti, quod a patre 
corripicorripio, -ere: to criticize posset?”
content.question: In line 2-3, iuvene egresso specifies

unit.text: 3: Pliny's Letters: Ghosts and Apparitions, Letters to Trajan and Calpurnia, and Teacher's Choice - Latin Prose

skill.text: 1.B: Describe how grammar contributes to the meaning and function of Latin words and phrases in context.
